name: rails
subtitle: Ruby On Rails
about: Ruby On Rails is an open-source web framework that's optimized for programmers happiness and sustainable productivity. It lets you write beautiful code by favoring convention over configuration.

videos.title: ActiveRecord Finders
videos.description: Let's learn some new tips about ActiveRecord Finders for Rails 4.

videos.title: ActiveModel
videos.description: In this episode we will look into ActiveModel class and when to use it.

videos.title: Routes, Ruby 1.9.3 and ThreadSafety
videos.description: What's new into Routes, Ruby 1.9.3 and ThreadSafety in Rails 4.

videos.title: Strong Parameters, Filters and Remote forms
videos.description: Let's take a look inside these news Rails features: Strong Parameters, Filters and Remote forms.

videos.title: Filters, Session, Custom Flash types
videos.description: Let's learn what changes into Filters, Session, Custom Flash types in Rails 4.

videos.title: Views
videos.description: In this video let's see some news changes into Rails Views.

videos.title: Testing
videos.description: In this video let's see the news features into native Rails test framework.

videos.title: ETags
videos.description: In this episode you will learn how to handle with ETags.

videos.title: Dalli and Cache Digests
videos.description: Let's learn about caching using Dalli and Cache Digests into Rails 4.

videos.title: Streaming and Turbolinks
videos.description: Let's learn how to use Streaming and Turbolinks to boost your Rails app.

videos.title: Consuming an API Using HTTParty and Creating a Gem
videos.description: Learn how to use HTTParty to consume an API and package your library into a gem.

videos.title: Forum Series: Architecture
videos.description: The first part of the Forum series, we talk about how the database and structure of the forum is designed.

videos.title: Forum Series: Nested Attributes and fields_for
videos.description: Learn how to use accepts_nested_attributes_for and fields_for to create forms that include associated models in them.

videos.title: Forum Series: Email Notifications, deliver_later, and Previews
videos.description: Learn how to send email notifications to users with Rails 4.2 ActionMailer, deliver_later, and email previews.

videos.title: Forum Series: Time Zones using the local_time Gem
videos.description: A look into times, timezones, and how to handle it better with javascript.

videos.title: Rails 4.2 Introduction
videos.description: A quick look at the new features of Rails 4.2 in the first beta that was recently released.

videos.title: A look into Routing
videos.description: Dive into routing more deeply than just basic resources and writing routes from scratch.

videos.title: Rails Application Structure
videos.description: A look into the files and folders inside every Rails application and how they fit together.

videos.title: User Authentication with Devise
videos.description: A look into user accounts, registration, login, forgot your password, and more.

videos.title: File Uploading with Carrierwave
videos.description: Using Rails to upload files manually and how you can do it even cleaner using Carrierwave.

videos.title: Pagination with will_paginate
videos.description: A look into how pagination works from scratch and how to use will_paginate.

videos.title: Pretty urls with FriendlyID
videos.description: Techniques for taking your database models and using attributes to generate pretty urls.

videos.title: Rake
videos.description: Today we begin a series on the Rake build tool. We'll be getting into some powerful, lesser-known features as we continue on; but we'll start out with a quick review of Rake basics.

videos.title: Rake Rules
videos.description: In this episode we learn how to write advanced Rake rules which programatically determine the appropriate prerequisites for a given target file.

videos.title: Rake MultiTask
videos.description: In this, the final (for now) episode of the Rake miniseries, we take a look at how to speed up Rake runs by taking advantage of multiple cores.
